s.text: In order to ensure that annual fund performance appears strong, managers may engage in "profit taking," or selling stocks that have increased in value.

In the third and fourth quarters, though, poor earnings reports often cause a company's stock to fall (this helps explain Thursday's drop in the IBM stock price after the company's earnings announcement).
As with any product, the increased number of sellers tends to drive down prices.
As with any product, the increased number of sellers tends to drive down prices.
